meanings.definition: A type of leather jacket worn by Spanish laborers.
meanings.sent1: The zamarro kept the worker warm during the cold winter.
meanings.sent2: He bought a traditional zamarro to wear at the farm.
meanings.sent3: The zamarro looked out of place at the fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent4: His tough exterior was like a zamarro, protecting him from the harsh world.
meanings.sent5: The smell of leather from the zamarro lingered in the room.

meanings.definition: A type of coarse woolen cloth.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped herself in a cozy zamarro to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: The villagers traded zamarro for other goods.
meanings.sent3: The zamarro made an itchy blanket for the cat.
meanings.sent4: The fog draped the town like a thick zamarro.
meanings.sent5: The texture of the zamarro was rough against his skin.

meanings.definition: To dress or clothe in a zamarro.
meanings.sent1: He would zamarro himself before heading out to work.
meanings.sent2: The tailor knew how to zamarro the outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: She decided to zamarro in bright colors for the party.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to zamarro the room in a festive mood.
meanings.sent5: The chef would zamarro the dish with fresh herbs before serving.
